oai_dc:dc.dc:title: VARIATION OF SEDIMENT SUSPENSION IN OSCILLATORY FLOW
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Staub, Carsten
Jonsson, Ivar G.
Svendsen, Ib A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: oscillatory flow
suspended sediment
variation of suspension
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Different syphon type suspended load probes were used together with a newly developed 'carousel' sampler for measurements of the instantaneous sediment concentration in turbulent oscillatory flow over a sand bed. Shields parameters were well above the rippled/flat bed transition region, resulting in intense sediment transport over a flat bed. The measurements were performed at different levels in a large oscillating water tunnel. They showed some characteristic features of the temporal concentration variation and of the variation with height of the mean concentration. Also a pronounced effect of the orientation of the suction tube relative to the flow was observed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 19 (1984): Proceedings of 19th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Houston, Texas, 1984.; 155
